description: Winner of n-th Littlewood Frog Race.
comments: For 0 < k <= n, gcd(n,k) = 1, let P(n,k) be the smallest prime of the form a*n+k, with a >= 0. "Frog" k0 is said to win "race" n if P(n,k0) is largest of the phi(n) values P(n,k).In case of draws of P(n,k) values take the largest k.- _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 26 2015
maple: A038025P := proc(n,k)    local a;    for a from 0 do        if isprime(a*n+k) then            return a;        end if;    end do:end proc:A038025 := proc(n)    local a,phimax,phi,k ;    a :=0 ;    phimax := 0 ;    for k from 1 to n do        if igcd(k,n) = 1 then            phi := A038025P(n,k) ;            if phi >= phimax then                a := k;                phimax := phi;            end if;        end if;    od;    a ;end proc:seq(A038025(n),n=1..100) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 26 2015
author: _Christian G. Bower_ from a problem by _David W. Wilson_
